name: Variable Watermilfoil (Hybrid)

Identifying Characteristics: Submersed bottle brush appearing aquatic plant
Stems: sturdy, up to 3m long, reddish
Leaves: feather divided with 5-14 leaflet pairs in whorls of 4-6, reddish in color, internodal space <5mm
Flowers: mid to late summer, arranged alternately and in whorls on emergent stalk with bracts (pinnately lobed to elongate, smooth margin)
Habitat: Well adapted – still and flowing water, under ice
Various substrates – organic muck, silt, sand, gravel

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
